intro: Pilosella fidalgoana, commonly known as the Fidalgo's pearly everlet, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a low-growing habit with hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically grayish-green with a woolly texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pilosella fidalgoana is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments.
